newsitem.title: USA: Endocardial gets FDA okay to expand cardiac trials.
newsitem.headline: Endocardial gets FDA okay to expand cardiac trials.

text.p: Endocardial Solutions Inc said Thursday it received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to expand trials of its cardiac diagnostic system to 71 patients in up to five states.
Endocardial said it is an important step in its goal of filing a pre-market approval application by late 1997 or early 1998.

The company has already conducted trials on 13 patients at the University of Michigan and the Cleveland Clinic. Two new sites -- Mayo Clinic and the University of Western Ontario -- were selected, and the company can choose a fifth site.
Endocardial said in addition to the 13, it has conducted 27 trials in Britain.

"The trials conducted so far support our belief that our product will help diagnose a vastly expanded population of complex arrhythmias that cannot be adequately diagnosed with today's technology while significantly reducing procedural time and cost," Jim Bullock, president and chief executive of Endocardial, said in a statement.
Endocardial's system provides a three-dimensional graphic display of the heart's electrical activity. Endocardial develops diagnostic products for the electrophysiology market.
